page.title: 12The Llangibby Hunt
page.content: The oldest recorded hunt in the county is called Llangibby. It was formed in l683. Many more people ride with it now as horse riding is a popular local recreation. On weekends there are about lOO riders. They wear black or red riding habit. Usually the first hunt is in November. Christmas and the New Year attracts a great number of protesters who lay false smells for the hounds. There are 62 couples of hounds - 64 in all. The hunters usually cover about 2O miles. Sometimes there are injuries - cuts,bruises and even broken ribs and the hounds too can get hurt going through wire fencing. The hunt meets at different locations - houses, pubs or farms. Most farmers welcome the hunt onto their land to keep down the foxes.
